556565-d-05-22-07-IC.Narrative: WHILE SWITCHING AT KINDER MORGAN, R93991-21 WAS SHOVING 14 CARS INTO THE RUN-AROUND TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR STOOD BY THE SWITCH BETWEEN THE RUN-AROUND AND THE B-SIDE TRACK AND THOUGHT IT WAS CLEAR ON THE NORTH END.  HE THEN SHOVED THE 14 LOADED HAZARDOUS CARS INTO THE RUN-AROUND AND SIDESWIPED THE TANK CAR THAT HAD BEEN PLACED ON THE 13B SPOT.  THE CONDUCTOR STATED THERE WAS NO INDICATION THAT HE HAD HIT SOMETHING AND NOT REALIZING WHAT HAD HAPPENED, HE CONTINUED ABOUT HIS WORK.  WHEN THEY WENT TOPULL THE TRACK BACK OUT, APPROX. 30 MINUTES LATER, HE NOTICED THAT THERE WAS DAMAGE TO DOWX 73245.HE THEN RODE THE CUT BACK INTO THE RUN-AROUND AND MET WITH THE FOREMAN AT KINDER MORGAN AND SAW THEDAMAGE TO CCBX 2449.  NOTHING WAS DERAILED IN THE INCIDENT.  NO LEAKS OR EXPOSURES.  THE CREW WAS DRUG & ALCOHOL TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.

The total distance traveled on the ground was approximately 1 car length.
Track Damage:$500 Car Damage: $1000
Forklift damage: ESTIMATED 10,000

554829-d-05-07-07-IC.Narrative: RCL95291-07, REMOTE SWITCHER, WAS SHOVING 45 CARS INTO TRACK #1.  WHEN THE 45TH CAR FROM THE ENGINEREACHED THE #3 SWITCH, CN 289201 PICKED THE #3 SWITCH AND DERAILED. 555721-d-05-16-07-IC.Narrative: M39491-16 WAS MOVING SOUTH ON THOROUGHFARE 3, CROSSING OVER THOROUGHFARE 4 WHEN THEY DERAILED 5 CARS. INVESTIGATION INTO THE ACCIDENT FOUND THAT THE LAST CREW TO USE THE CROSSOVER SWITCHES WAS FROM THE CSXT.  IT  IS BELIEVED THAT THEY FAILED TO PROPERLY LOCK THE SWITCH AND WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE WHO THOSE EMPLOYEES ARE.  MEASURE HAVE BEEN PUT INTO PLACE TO PREVENT THIS FROM RE-OCCURRING.

NW0507114-d-05-17-07-BNSF.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 2220 HOURS JOB Y-ESJ2292-17A DERAILED CAR BN 238933 WHILE PULLING CARS FROM CONTAINER YARD TO STORAGE 4 (2604).  CREW WAS UNAWARE THAT CAR WAS ON THE GROUND.  SUBSEQUENT SWITCH MOVE BY JOB Y-ESJ2301-17A ON THE LEAD AT THE EAST END OF STORAGE 7 (2507) RESULTED IN THE DERAILMENT OF CAR ETTX 820979 DUE TO SWITCH DAMAGE AND DEBRIS CREATED BY PREVIOUSLY DERAILED CAR.  7/08/2008 - T R AND D FINISHED EVALUATION OF THIS INCIDENT WITHOUT DETERMINING ACTUAL CAUSE - SUGGEST M507.  THE CARWAS DERAILED FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF TIME AND AS IT TRAVERSED NUMEROUS SWITCHES AND TRACK APPLIANCES IT WAS FALLING APART.  IN THE INITIAL NARRATIVE IT WAS STATED THAT IT DERAILED DUE TO DEBRIS FROMA PREVIOUS DERAILMENT REFERRED TO THE DEBRIS FALLING OFF THE TRUCK AND BEING DRAGGED ALONG AFTER THE POD.

555299-d-05-12-07-WC.Narrative: WHILE PERFORMING NORMAL SWITCHING OPERATIONS, YFY058 WAS INSTRUCTED TO GET TRACK N074 TOGETHER AND SHOVE IT TO THE NORTH END OF TRACK N266.  CREW TIED ONTO THE SOUTH END OF TRACK N074 AND REMOVED 12 HANDBRAKES OFF OF THE SOUTH END.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN STRETCHED THE TRACK AND DIDN'T FEEL HE HAD ALL THE CARS.  THE BRAKEMAN WAS ON HIS WAY TO THE NORTH END OF THE YARD TO PROTECT THE SHOVE ON N266 ANDSTARTED TO TIE HANDBRAKES ON TRACK N074 TO SLOW THE CUT OF CARS SO THAT THEY WOULD MAKE A SLOWER COUPLING.  THE CREW NOTICED THE CARS HAD ROLLED INTO THE OTHER CARS IN THE TRACK AND THE BRAKEMAN REMOVED HIS HANDBRAKES AND CONTINUED NORTH.  THEY STRETCHED THE TRACK AGAIN AND THE BRAKEMAN VERIFIED THAT THE 2 NORTH CARS WERE MOVING SOUTH.  THE CREW DID NOT REALIZE THAT THE COUPLING HAD NOT MADE AND THE CARS WERE ROLLING WITH THE SOUTH SLOPE OF THE YARD.  THEY ASSUMED ALL THE CARS WERE TOGETHER ON N074 AND PULLED SOUTH.  BY THE TIME THEY NOTICED THE CARS ROLLING OUT OF N074 TRACK SOUTH DOWN THE LEAD THEY TOLD THE ENGINEER TO STOP THE MOVEMENT.  YFY 058 WAS ON N266 AND SIDESWIPED BY THE CARS ROLLING BACK.  NOTHING WAS DERAILED.  CARS: ECUX 85408, GMRC 7154 AND WC 26621 WERE DAMAGED.

104447-d-05-21-07-ATK.Contributing Accident Cause: Automatic brake, insufficient (H001) -- see note after cause H599
104447-d-05-21-07-ATK.Narrative: TRAIN NO.#5 WAS SHOVING INTO THE BAGGAGE SPUR TRACK TO PICK UP AND COUPLE PRIVATE CAR C/800285.  WHEN THE TRAIN  COUPLED TO C/800285, THE MOVEMENT SHOVED THE PRIVATE CAR INTO THE BUMPING POST.  THE MAIN FACTORS IN THIS ACCIDENT WERE THE USE OF EXCESSIVE HORSEPOWER (H524) AND INSUFFICIENT AUTOMATIC BRAKE REDUCTION (H510).  WHEN THE ENGINEER RELEASED THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE TO SHOVE BACK, THE EXCESSIVE AMPS CAUSED THE TRAIN TO START BACK SUDDENLY.  WHEN THE ENGINEER DID REDUCE THE CONTROLLER (THROTTLE), THE TRAIN CONTINUED TO ROLL DUE TO INSUFFICENT BRAKE REDUCTION, RESULTING IN THE TRAIN HITTINGTHE BUMPING POST BEFORE STOPPING.

I1007-d-05-06-07-PATH.Contributing Accident Cause: Cause under active investigation by reporting railroad  (Amended report will be forwarded when repor
I1007-d-05-06-07-PATH.Narrative:
AN ELECTRICAL FIRE IGNITED IN THE CAB OF CAR 639 AND ADJACENT CARS 764 AND 874 STORED IN SOUTH ST YARD, AFTER THE HEATING UNIT MALFUNCTIONED.  NO PERSONNEL OR PASSENGERS WERE ON BOARD THIS TRAIN.DURING A ROUTINE INSPECTION OF THE TRAINCARS IN SOUTH ST YARD, A CAR INSPECTOR TURNED ON CAR 639 TOPREPARE IT FOR SERVICE AS NORMAL.  AT APPROXIMATELY 10:58, POWER WAS REMOVED FROM TRACK H9-10 AND EMERGENCY CALLS WERE MADE TO PAPD AND THE NEWARK FIRE DEPARTMENT, AS THE FIRE WAS BURNING OUT OF CONTROL.  THE CAR INSPECTORS REQUESTED POWER REMOVAL ON TRACK G9-10 AT 11:04, THEN RESTORED POWER AFTERMOVING ADJACENT CARS TO PREVENT FURTHER DAMAGE AND TO ALLOW ACCESS FOR NEWARK FD TO RESPOND FROM MCCARTER HIGHWAY.  NEWARK FD BEGAN FIGHTING THE FIRE AT APPROXIMATELY 11:07PM AND ENDED AT 1:20 AM.  CAR 764 SUSTAINED THE MOST DAMAGE AND IS A TOTAL LOSS.  CAR 639 INCURRED SCORCHING TO THE FIBERGLASS END BONNET AND DAMAGE TO THE WINDOW GLAZING.  CAR 874 INCURRED ONLY WINDOW GLAZING.  BOTH CARS 639 AND 874 WILL BE REPAIRED AND RESTORED TO SERVICE.  ONE INJURY WAS REPORTED OF SMOKE INHALATION BY THEENGINEER THAT DROVE CARS 874 AND 764 TO HARRISON FROM SOUTH ST YARD FOR OBSERVATION AND REPAIR.  ALLWORKERS HAVE BEEN ADVISED TO WEAR PRESCRIBED SAFETY EQUIPMENT WHILE WORKING ON OR AROUND THESE CARS.      

RESPONDING TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE INCLUDED CED CAR INSPECTORS, POWER RAILMAN, TRACK FOREMAN, THE NEWARK SIGNAL MAINTAINER AND OE.  NOTIFICATIONS WERE MADE TO THE SUPERINTENDENT, DIRECTOR, AN

AT THIS LOCATION THE NORTH RAIL PUSHED OUT UNDER LOAD AND THE SOUTH WHEELS OF THE LEAD TRUCK (A-END) OF THE 13TH CAR NW 189103 FELL IN THE GAUGE.  AS THE CAR DERAILED APPROACHED THE SWITCH POINT, WHERE THE GUARD GAVE ADDITIONAL STRENGTH TO THE STOCK RAIL, THE NORTH WHEELS CLIMBED OUTSIDE TOWARD THE EDGE OF THE WALL, IT PULLED THE REAR TRUCK (A-END)OF THE 12TH CAR (NW 189197) OFF THE TRACK.  THE REAR TRUCK OF RAILCAR NW 189103 AND THE LAST CAR (UTCX 48712) DERAILED AS THEY PULLED THROUGH  THE DAMAGED TRACK AREA.
